page.title: 12POLLUTION IN THE SOUND
page.content: Seven different places along the {coast}of Plymouth were tested for {pollution}.The pollution was{measured in pH. A pH of seven indicates pure water. If above or below, it is slightly polluted. PLACE POLLUTION Jennycliff 8.2 pH Bovisand 6.9 pH Turnchapel 7.9 pH Radford Lake 8.8 pH Laira 7.3 pH Queen Annes Battery 8.1 pH Citadel 7.2 pH There was a lot of{litter}around Jennycliff beach because each morning the birds turned out the bins for scraps of food. At Turnchapel and Queen Annes Battery the water looked very dirty. At Fort Bovisand the water looked very clear. The Sound is a lot less polluted than we expected.
